body.p:
Head Quarters 65th Kentucky
Enrold Militia
Paintsville Johnson Co Ky
August 5th 1864
To his Excencley Thomas E Bramlit Gavoner of the State of Kentucky

In obedieance to your order ordering me to make a company of active militia I am indevering to make the company and have detailed one hundred & one men and have Fifty Five in camp in Paintsville and have put Lieut Col G. W. Brown in command he being the best driled man and I think the most compatant in my Reidgmment and Recamend that he be commissioned as captain of the company and have appointed E. H. Walker First Lieutenant C. G. second Lieutenant and John Turner Third Lieutenant and Recommend that they be commissioned if it is leagal for me to appoint the officier I made an effort to map the company by volunteers but could not get more than five or six I then made the detail by ballet out of the Sevral Companys in the Reidgment on the 23th of this instant we are subsisten gitting our subsistance from the country have about 45 guns 10 enfield a few shot guns and the balance old guns that the Rebeles left Scaterd about in the country I have vary litle amunition only a litle I got from the united States Troops at Louisa.

We have a bad chance of information here have no mail to this place the nerist is
to Louisa which is 32. miles I have no regulations nor nothing to govern me in my duty in organinzeing the company I tharefore desire all the information from you that ^you^ can give me as it respects the organization of the company and ^how^ they are to be armed & Equipted & clothed and furnished with Subsistence & Co.
Thare is a good meny Reble Gerrillars in this country and I think the company might be in agrat deal of danger in camp without being beter armed tharefore desire that I heare from you imeadatly..

The office of Captain in Company beleave Vacant B. having become vacant I had an election heldd in said company on the 3th of this instant and John S. Miller wase elected Captain on Jessey Murry Third Lieutenant in same company Co. C. John Hilman First Lieutenant Co. E. Nathaniel PSimer wase elected Captain William Vanhoose First Lieutenant & Asey J Fairchild Second Lieutenant-

The gurillar Sidney Coop made a rade in Paintsville on the night of the 16 July ^with about fifty men^ and Robed the storse with about fifty men and the shrriff caled on me and ordered me my Ridgment in and had to Send to Louisa for amunition and hunt up the guns from the country and started in pursuit
of the thievs on the 23th about 5 ock P. M. and marched about 15 miles that night the next day pursued on within 7 miles of West liberty and run him out which is about 35 miles from here took several prisoners but coud not git evidance against but one who he belonged to the band I sent him to Louisa and turned him over to the united States forces
I had seventy Five men with me I went in person G. W. Braun Lt Col & W. W. House Adjt was in the scout with me

At the Election on the 1st instant thare wase assale assned at apart of the voting precients for Col Colonel and Lieutenant Colonel and one Mr Auxier wase paled for Colonel & C. C. Price for Lieutenant Colonel and having no wase Eleted the peple no agenral thing in this county did not under stand that that wase the time for Electing a Colonel & Lieut Clonel if it had ben so under stood they could have Elected A loyal man to have to filed them officers, and I think thare is general ^did^satisfaction

Burges Preston
Col Comdg, 65, Ky, E, M
